thread.title: SIG Combibloc picks banks for Zurich flotation -sources

title: SIG Combibloc picks banks for Zurich flotation -sources

organizations.name: credit suisse and bank of america

text:
April 9, 2018 / 2:10 PM / in 20 minutes SIG Combibloc picks banks for Zurich flotation -sources Arno Schuetze 1 Min Read 
FRANKFURT, April 9 (Reuters) - Swiss packaging maker SIG Combibloc is moving ahead with preparations for an autumn stock market listing in Zurich that could value it at about 4.5 billion euros ($5.5 billion), two people close to the matter said. 
Its private equity owner Onex has hired Goldman Sachs, Credit Suisse and Bank of America as so-called global coordinators for the listing, the sources said. ($1 = 0.8119 euros) (Reporting by Arno Schuetze Editing by Douglas Busvine)
